Description: A very long string of long, cigar-shaped beads of turquoise-blue glazed composition with a spiral decoration of black glaze. They vary slightly in thickness and some are broken. At various points along the string are threaded nine sliced 'Nassa' shells. The arrangement in the string is certainly modern.
Curator's comments: This was almost certainly once a string with 1902,1011.104. Cf. T. E. Peet, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part II. 1911-12’ (London, 1914), pl.IX, 2: R. Engelbach 'Harageh' (London, 1923), pl.XV, 3: W. M. F. Petrie & J. H. Walker, ‘Qurneh’ (London, 1901), pl.VIII, 17: all Middle Kingdom. But cf. also D. Randall-McIver & A. C. Mace, ‘el Amrah and Abydos’ (London, 1902), pl.XLIV (Second Intermediate Period) and G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' III (London, 1927-30), pl. XI, 40 (Pan Grave).
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (542)
